This is the cutest place. I found via yelp as it was nearby our hostel, and my friends and I had an excellent late lunch. For less than 10 euros we got to choose an appetizer, entree, dessert, and also got wine and complimentary bread. The waitress was very sweet and explained the whole menu in English and made sure our choices accommodated with our tastes. The owner (I think) of the restaurant also came out and gave us an extra treat to say thank you for visiting his restaurant. I assume this is more of a hole in the wall that tourists don't usually go to, but I highly recommend it! Their menu also changes up every day so just go with whatever the waitress recommends!
